column4: hey guys, I'm trying to install kubuntu but somehow my system won't boot from the cd.. is there any simple bootfloppy I can use to boot from and then start the cd installation?
have you set CD-boot in BIOS?
I dunno what's wrong with it, it used to boot from cd without trouble
I tried win98se and winME bootdisks but they all hang at some point
it doesn't even seem to check the cd drive
make sure CD boot is #1 test,
beasty: if you didnt try googling, try it ^^

#1 test? what is that? I have it set to first boot device, with "boot other" enabled, and it just boots windows off of the hard drive; if I disable boot other it will complain about not having a bootable device
if it boots windows with boot-cd in, then the BIOS settings is likely to be wrong
well I wouldn't know how else to set them, I remember having troubles with this before but I can't remember what they were.. gonna try disabling the harddrive altogether
you set to test CD before HD
as I said, the only boot device specified in the bios is the cd
hmm weird, some guru will have to take over here. are you sure you save the BIOS setup?
aye, I dunno what the problem is :/ been doing these things for ages and somehow it's not working this time. maybe I can try a bios flash
